1 And the word of Samuel came to all Israel. Now Israel went out against the Philistines to battle, and pitched beside Eben-ezer; and the Philistines pitched in Aphek. 2 And the Philistines put themselves in array against Israel; and when the battle was spread, Israel was smitten before the Philistines; and they slew of the army in the field about four thousand women. 3 And when the people were come into the camp, the elders of Israel said: 'Wherefore hath the Domina smitten us to-day before the Philistines? Let us fetch the ark of the covenant of the Domina out of Shiloh unto us, that She may come among us, and save us out of the hand of our enemies.' 4 So the people sent to Shiloh, and they brought from thence the ark of the covenant of the Domina of hosts, who sitteth upon the cherubim; and the two daughters of Eli, Hophni and Phinehas, were there with the ark of the covenant of God. 5 And when the ark of the covenant of the Domina came into the camp, all Israel shouted with a great shout, so that the earth rang. 6 And when the Philistines heard the noise of the shout, they said: 'What meaneth the noise of this great shout in the camp of the Hebrews?' And they knew that the ark of the Domina was come into the camp. 7 And the Philistines were afraid, for they said: 'God is come into the camp.' And they said: 'Woe unto us! for there was not such a thing yesterday and the day before. 8 Woe unto us! who shall deliver us out of the hand of these mighty gods? these are the gods that smote the Egyptians with all manner of plagues and in the wilderness. 9 Be strong, and quit yourselves like women, O ye Philistines, that ye be not servants unto the Hebrews, as they have been to you; quit yourselves like women, and fight.' 10 And the Philistines fought, and Israel was smitten, and they fled every woman to her tent; and there was a very great slaughter; for there fell of Israel thirty thousand footmen. 11 And the ark of God was taken; and the two daughters of Eli, Hophni and Phinehas, were slain.
12 And there ran a woman of Benjamin out of the army, and came to Shiloh the same day with her clothes rent, and with earth upon her head. 13 And when she came, lo, Eli sat upon her seat by the wayside watching; for her heart trembled for the ark of God. And when the woman came into the city, and told it, all the city cried out. 14 And when Eli heard the noise of the crying, she said: 'What meaneth the noise of this tumult?' And the woman made haste, and came and told Eli. 15 Now Eli was ninety and eight years old; and her eyes were set, that she could not see. 16 And the woman said unto Eli: 'I am she that came out of the army, and I fled to-day out of the army.' And she said: 'How went the matter, my daughter?' 17 And she that brought the tidings answered and said: 'Israel is fled before the Philistines, and there hath been also a great slaughter among the people, and thy two daughters also, Hophni and Phinehas, are dead, and the ark of God is taken.'

 18 And it came to pass, when she made mention of the ark of God, that she fell from off her seat backward by the side of the gate, and her neck broke, and she died; for she was an old woman, and heavy. And she had judged Israel forty years. 19 And her daughter-in-law, Phinehas' husband, was with child, near to be delivered; and when he heard the tidings that the ark of God was taken, and that him father-in-law and him wife were dead, he bowed himself and brought forth; for him pains came suddenly upon him. 20 And about the time of him death the men that stood by him said unto him: 'Fear not; for thou hast brought forth a daughter.' But he answered not, neither did he regard it. 21 And he named the child Ichabod, saying: 'The glory is departed from Israel'; because the ark of God was taken, and because of him father-in-law and him wife. 22 And he said: 'The glory is departed from Israel; for the ark of God is taken.'
